result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on August 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case called: 4:07 pm
INCLUDES 15CM2018, 16CM676, 16CM679, 16CM949, 16CM1178.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Lou Ann Bohn;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CM2018:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal))>>DRI.

16CM676:
Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property-Repeater)>>DRI.

16CM949:
Ct. 3 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (DC-Repeater)>>DRI.

16CM1178:
Ct. 1 (DC)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (BJ)>>DRI.

Uncharged DA Case 16MA2510 is to be dismissed.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
16CM679:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

16CM949:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (BJ-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
16CM679:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, No Contact with County Market (Wausau), Shopko (Wausau), B.B., C.W., Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample.

Ct. 2 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, No Contact with County Market (Wausau), Shopko (Wausau), B.B., C.W., Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs.

16CM949:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, No Contact with County Market (Wausau), Shopko (Wausau), B.B., C.W., Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample.  Restitution in amount to be determined.

Ct. 2 (BJ-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, No Contact with County Market (Wausau), Shopko (Wausau), B.B., C.W., Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs. Restitution in amount to be determined.

DATES: Restitution Hearing to be set 16CM676 AND 16CM949.

Adjourned: 4:30 pm

MINUTES AMENDED 7/15/2016 @ 10:30 am
Final pre-trial on July 11, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2016 at 11:15 am.

INCLUDES 15CM2018, 16CM679, & 16CM676   Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 on or before PTC.   No contact with County Market & Shopko. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
